title: Print, "Cover Design for The New Yorker Magazine", 1943
medium: Zinc cut of a linoleum print, graphite on white paper
signed: Inside leaf in graphite: With good wishes for whatever the year may bring / The Nylands
inscribed: In Mr. Mitchell's hand: New Year's 1944. By Karasz, Wm Nyland's wife. / Zinc cut, proof of cover design, drawn for the New Yorker and published by them in 1944.
provenance: 1944: Mr. and Mrs. William Franklin Mitchell (from Ilonka Karasz); 1955: acquired by Museum
description: A folded New Year's card printed with an all over design composed of small figures and stylized trees. A large five pointed star is incorporated into the design.

tombstone.epitaph: Print, "Cover Design for The New Yorker Magazine", 1943. Zinc cut of a linoleum print, graphite on white paper. 1955-111-43.
